required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Low and High Doses of Prophylactic Vitamin D in Prevention of Osteopenia of Prematurity
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison Between Low and High Doses of Prophylactic Vitamin D in Prevention of Osteopenia of Prematurity

brief_summary.textblock: In this study the effects of low and high doses of prophylactic vitamin D on biochemical and radiological manifestations of osetopenia of prematurity will be tested.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will be conducted on (80) preterm infants that fulfill the eligibility criteria and delivered at Alexandria University Maternity Hospital (AUMH).

primary_outcome.description: Serum calcium level will be measured and analyzed using Advia 1800 chemistry system (Simens Germany). Normal level: 8.5 to 10.5 mg/dl
Serum phosphorus level will be measured and analyzed using Advia 1800 chemistry system (Simens Germany). Normal level: 3.4 to 4.5 mg/dl
Serum alkaline phosphate level will be measured and analyzed using Advia 1800 chemistry system (Simens Germany). Normal level: 50-100 U/L.

Serum 25-Hydroxy Vitamin D level will be measured and analyzed using Electrochemilumiescence binding assay on cobas e immunoassay analyzer. The reference range of the total 25(OH)D level is 25-80 ng/mL.
This will be evaluated using an x-ray of left wrist
This will be evaluated using an x-ray of left wrist
This will be evaluated using an x-ray of left wrist

primary_outcome.measure: Cupping of metaphyseal edge of bone
primary_outcome.description: This will be evaluated using an x-ray of left wrist

primary_outcome.measure: Widening of the distal end of the metaphysis of bone
primary_outcome.description: This will be evaluated using an x-ray of left wrist

arm_group.description: Patients will receive low-dose vitamin D (200 IU/d)
Patients will receive high-dose vitamin D (1600 IU/d)

intervention.description: Patients will receive a 200 IU/d vitamin D since they tolerate full enteral nutrition.
Patients will receive 1600 IU/d vitamin D since they tolerate full enteral nutrition.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Newborns with gestational age of ≤ 32 weeks and birth weight ≤ 1500 g.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Newborns whose mothers were taking specific medications interacting with vitamin D metabolism (e.g., anticonvulsants, diuretics)
- Being NPO (nothing per oral) for more than 2 wks
- Gestational age more than 32 weeks
- Birth weight more than 1500 grams

overall_official.affiliation: Faculty of Medicine, Alexandria University, Egypt

facility.name: Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU) of Alexandria University Maternity Hospital.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Lecturer in Pediatrics, Faculty of Medicine
